channel.title: Data Analytics on Teddy's online desktop
channel.description: Recent content in Data Analytics on Teddy's online desktop

item.title: Random Number Generator
item.description: I wanted to generate a set of random numbers without resorting to the rand() function in excel. I found this paper by Michael Lampton, Space Sciences Lab, UC Berkeley: https://research.ssl.berkeley.edu/~mlampton/RandomSpreadsheet4.pdf The paper has a formula for calculating a random value using a modulus function on a large number, but is also concerned with how portable such randomly generated numbers are between different software and hardware platforms. Here’s my attempt at a summary of the formulas used within that paper:

item.title: Duck DB and Pandas Profiling
item.description: Saw a nice introduction to Duck DB: https://shekhargulati.com/2019/12/15/the-5-minute-introduction-to-duckdb-the-sqlite-for-analytics/ Pandas Profiling for generating automatic data summary reports: https://github.com/ydataai/pandas-profiling

item.title: Google Data Analytics Certificate
item.description: I’ve finally completed the Coursera Google Data Analytics Certificate. I think the course is great for beginners in data analytics. For me it was a great refresher on SQL and R but the other sections were not all that useful. The course did motivate me to learn R (again) and this blog site is probably a result of that. I think the course could use more on statistical thinking and spending more time on probability since data analysts could really use that in their work.
